availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Quincy Ward (Harrison County, KY, Com'th atty pro tem)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, and Harrison County, Kentucky, attorney and commonwealth’s attorney. Scott County native. Son of Cary Aldry Ward and Eliza Jane Risk Ward. Married to Mary E. Miller Ward in Harrison County, Kentucky, on November 30, 1865. Student in Scott County in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Graduated from Georgetown College in Georgetown in 1858. Law student in Scott County in 1860. Household owned six enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860. County attorney of Harrison County in 1862. Commonwealth’s attorney pro tem in Harrison County in 1863.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, 1862-1869, Film 000216898, p. 96-97.
